sen.e: Koetsu-ji Temple is a Buddhist temple belonging to the Nichiren Sect located in Takagamine, Kita Ward, Kyoto City.

sen.j: 江戸時代の芸術家である本阿弥光悦に元和 (日本)元年（1615年）に徳川家康がこの地を与えた。
sen.e: The Edo period artist Koetsu HONAMI was granted the site by Ieyasu TOKUGAWA in 1615.

sen.e: Koetsu's family and numerous artisans moved into the area and formed an art community.

sen.j: 光悦の死後に屋敷は寺となり本人の墓碑を祀っている。
sen.e: The estate became a temple following Koetsu's death and his gravestone still stands within the temple grounds.

sen.j: 境内の茶室「大虚庵」は光悦が晩年を過ごしたとされるところであり、その前の竹の垣根は光悦垣またはその姿から臥牛（ねうし）垣と呼ばれ徐々に高さの変る独特のものである。
sen.e: The "Taikyo-an Teahouse" within the temple precinct is said to be where Koetsu spent his final years and the bamboo fence at its front, known as a "Koetsu-gaki" after Koetsu HONAMI or "Neushi-gaki" (lit. Sleeping Cow Fence" after his shape, is characterized by its gradually changing height.
